title: NASA Awards Balloon Operations Follow-On Contract
summary: NASA has awarded a follow-on contract to Northrop Grumman Systems Corporation of Greenbelt, Maryland, for support of the agency’s Columbia Scientific Balloon Facility, located in Palestine, Texas.

title: U.S. government urged to address supply risks in the space sector
summary: As space becomes increasingly important to military operations, DoD should address supply risks in the space sector given the volatility of the market, experts said.

title: The manager of Blue Origin’s rocket engine program has left the company
summary: "He also built a world-class Engines team."

title: NASA to Discuss Artemis Strategy for Astronaut Moon Landers
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 3:30 p.m. EDT Wednesday, March 23, to provide an update on the agency’s goals to transport astronauts from lunar orbit to the surface of the Moon under Artemis.

title: Legally, Russia can’t just take its Space Station and go home
summary: Ignore Dmitry Rogozin. Putin is the real decision maker.

title: GEO operators say they can compete against LEO systems on cost
summary: Despite all the investment in low Earth orbit broadband megaconstellations, operators of geostationary satellites argue they can offer more cost-effective services.

title: Telstra to build teleports for OneWeb constellation
summary: Australian communications company Telstra announced plans March 22 to build and maintain three dedicated teleports to provide satellite gateway services in the Southern Hemisphere for OneWeb’s broadband constellation.

title: SpaceX assigns newer Starship, Super Heavy booster to orbital launch debut
summary: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk says that Super Heavy Booster B4 and Starship S20 are no longer scheduled to support the first orbital-class...

title: SES to acquire Leonardo DRS satcom business for $450 million
summary: Leonardo DRS, a provider of satellite communications services to the U.S. government, announced March 22 it is selling its satcom business to satellite operator SES in a $450 million deal.

title: Lockheed Martin to launch new satellite bus aimed at mid-size market
summary: Lockheed Martin plans to launch to orbit later this year a new satellite bus the company designed for both the commercial and government markets.
